revised_title: Description of a Dual-Function Maximum and Minimum Thermometer
tldr: The author describes a new instrument that combines the functions of a maximum and minimum thermometer, invented by James Hicks. The device uses a vertical and horizontal tube filled with mercury and spirits of wine, respectively, and features two magnetic indices to record maximum and minimum temperatures. This instrument provides a reliable method for measuring temperature changes and can be used as a wet-bulb thermometer.
